> I nominate it for the 2007 Restless awards, ..
>
> I know this mailing list has not, historically, had such awards, but
> now is as good a time to start as any....

Amazon did well in:

== The 2006 'What Now How' Awards for REST Protocols* ==

with their S3 interface.

Shame they've lost their touch and gone STREST**.   =0)

*  http://duncan-cragg.org/blog/post/2006-what-now-how-awards-rest-protocols/
** http://duncan-cragg.org/blog/post/strest-service-trampled-rest-will-break-web-20/
_____________________________________________

Now that there's quite a momentum behind REST, perhaps we should take
this opportunity to use SimpleDB as a poster child (in the true sense
of 'sad-looking, symbolic instance in need of our help').

Amazon is a high profile organisation with lots of skin in the Web 2.0 game.

Let's try and get them to change to good Web architecture, then hype
up the media attention...

_________________________________
Duncan Cragg
Web Application Architect
The Financial Times Group (UK)
http://www.ft.com
